frame.name: Vocalizations
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is concerned with the sounds produced by animate entities by means of their vocal tracts. Descriptions of sounds from artifacts meant to emulate such sounds, or to act as vocalizing animals or people, are also treated here as figurative language.
<ex>He woke up because of the <t>cries</t> <fex name="Sound_source">of the crows outside</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Sound_source
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity that is construed as a single point source emitting sound.
<ex>He woke up because of the <t>cries</t> <fex name="Sound_source">of the crows outside</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Location_of_sound_source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place from which the sound emanates.
<ex>There followed a small silence that was interrupted by a distant <t>cries</t> of caged birds <fex name="Location_of_sound_source">from the interior</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location at which sound is produced. This FE differs from <fen>Location_of_sound_source</fen> in that it does not highlight the sound's spreading from its source to the perceiver's location, which is usually indicated by the preposition "from".
<ex>The <t>hiss</t> of snakes <fex name="Place">outside the tent</fex> was a constant source of worry.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>The noise-making may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen>, that is the mental or emotional state of an animate <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
<ex>We proceeded despite his stifled <t>cries</t> <fex name="Internal_cause">of pain</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Certain properties of the sound relating to its production, loudness, etc may be of lexicographic interest if they describe properties of a sounds as such: loudly, shrilly, etc.
<ex>The Brigadier had heard the <fex name="Manner">faint</fex> <t>squeak</t> of rats.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions that indicate the loudness of the sound.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE idntifies the <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> that the <fen>Sound_source</fen> produces the sound. Generally, this is some external stimulus that prompts the <fen>Sound_source</fen> to make noise.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> along which the sound travels away from the <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
<ex>The books he wrote later tell how he never forgot the <t>howl</t> of the wolf <fex name="Path">across the icy field of Otsego</fex> on cold winter nights.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: cry.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a distinctive call of a bird or other animal.

lexUnit.name: howl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long doleful cry uttered by an animal such as a dog.

lexUnit.name: squeak.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short, high-pitched sound or cry
